rows: The message of H.E. Ranil Wickremesinghe, President of Sri Lanka for Christmas 2023

President of Sri Lanka, H.E. Ranil Wickremesinghe, delivered Christmas Day messages in English, Sinhala, and Tamil for Christmas 2023. The messages were aimed at conveying his wishes and spreading festive cheer to the people of Sri Lanka.
Inaugural Session of Sri Lanka-Nepal Joint Commission at Foreign Ministers’ Level successfully concluded in Kathmandu

Foreign Minister Ali Sabry successfully concluded a two-day official visit to Nepal on December 21 and 22, 2023. During the visit, he co-chaired the inaugural session of the Sri Lanka-Nepal Joint Commission at the Foreign Ministers' level in Kathmandu.
Rescue and Repatriation of Sri Lankan victims of human trafficking in Myanmar

The Ministry of Foreign Affairs is addressing the situation in Myanmar where Sri Lankan nationals are victims of human trafficking for cybercrimes. Efforts are being made for the rescue and repatriation of these victims.
High Commissioner of the Republic of India presents Credentials to Sri Lanka
The Government of India has appointed Mr. Santosh Jha as the High Commissioner of India to Sri Lanka, based in Colombo. He has presented his credentials to the Sri Lankan government.
Sri Lanka Foreign Service Association contributes to Lady Ridgeway Children’s Hospital lifesaving initiatives

The Sri Lanka Foreign Service Association (SLFSA) successfully concluded two fundraising initiatives to support the Lady Ridgeway Hospital for Children (LRH) in procuring life-saving equipment. The contributions from SLFSA will help enhance the hospital's lifesaving initiatives.
Foreign Minister Ali Sabry to Visit Kathmandu for the Inaugural Session of the Sri Lanka-Nepal Joint Commission

Foreign Minister Ali Sabry is set to visit Kathmandu from December 20-22, 2023, to participate in the Inaugural Session of the Sri Lanka-Nepal Joint Commission at the Foreign Ministers’ level. During the visit, the Foreign Minister will lead the Sri Lankan delegation in discussions aimed at strengthening bilateral ties between the two countries.
Foreign Minister Ali Sabry attends the Doha Forum-2023 in Qatar

Foreign Minister Ali Sabry visited Qatar to attend the 21st Edition of the Doha Forum with the theme 'Building Shared Futures' on December 10-11, 2023. He was invited by Pri to participate in the event, which aimed to foster international cooperation and dialogue.
Visit of HRH Princess Anne, the Princess Royal of the UK

Her Royal Highness Princess Anne, The Princess Royal of the United Kingdom, will visit Sri Lanka from January 10 to 13, 2024. She will be accompanied by her spouse, Vice Admiral Sir Tim Laurence. The visit aims to strengthen diplomatic ties between the UK and Sri Lanka.

Today marks the 75th Anniversary of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights (UDHR), and Sri Lanka sees this milestone as an opportunity to reaffirm the importance of human rights for all. It is a time to reflect on the intrinsic value of human rights and their significance in promoting equality and dignity for everyone.
Foreign Minister Ali Sabry to participate at the Doha Forum in Qatar
Foreign Minister Ali Sabry will visit Qatar from December 9-12, 2023, to participate in the Doha Forum. He is set to engage in high-level discussions during the event.

The 'International Bazaar & Cultural Extravaganza 2023' took place in Colombo, organized by the Sri Lanka Foreign Service Association and diplomatic missions. The event aimed to raise funds for charitable causes and promote cultural exchange.
Saudi Minister of Economy and Planning meets with Foreign Minister Ali Sabry

Saudi Minister of Economy and Planning, Faisal bin Alibrahim, visited Sri Lanka on November 26-27, 2023, where he met with Foreign Minister Ali Sabry. The meeting aimed to discuss bilateral economic cooperation between Saudi Arabia and Sri Lanka.

The Ministry of Foreign Affairs wrapped up an orientation program for 10 Heads of Mission-designate appointed by President Ranil Wickremesinghe. The Ambassadors-designate then paid a courtesy call on President. The new Ambassadors-designate are now ready to assume their duties.
Four Sri Lankans stranded in Gaza safely arrived in Sri Lanka

Four Sri Lankans, including a family, who were stranded in Gaza, safely arrived in Sri Lanka on November 24, 2023. The Consular Affairs Division of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs facilitated their repatriation.
Special Envoy of the Chinese President, Shen Yiqin led an official delegation to Sri Lanka

Chinese President Xi Jinping's Special Envoy and State Councilor Shen Yiqin visited Sri Lanka from 19 November 2023 as part of an official delegation. Shen Yiqin, who is also the President of the All-China Women's Federation, led the delegation during the four-day visit.
Deepavali Celebrations at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs

The Ministry of Foreign Affairs celebrated Deepavali with the Diplomatic Corps and Ministry staff. Foreign Minister Ali Sabry spoke at the event, emphasizing the significance of the occasion. The celebration aimed to foster cultural understanding and strengthen diplomatic ties.
High level Communist Party delegation from Vietnam call on the Acting Minister of Foreign Affairs

A high-level delegation from the Communist Party of Vietnam, led by Bui Van Nghiem, Member of the Party Central Committee term XIII, and Secretary of the Provincial Party Committee, called on the Acting Minister of Foreign Affairs. The delegation, consisting of 35 members, engaged in discussions with the Acting Minister during the meeting.
Sri Lanka elected to the Executive Board of the UNESCO

Sri Lanka has been elected to the Executive Board of UNESCO for the term 2023-2027 during the 42nd General Conference. This appointment highlights Sri Lanka's increased involvement in the inter-governmental organization.
Foreign Minister Ali Sabry to attend the 3rd Ministerial Conference on Maritime Security and Safety in the Western Indian Ocean in Mauritius

Foreign Minister Ali Sabry has been invited by Mauritius' Minister of Foreign Affairs to attend the 3rd Ministerial Conference on Maritime Security and Safety in the Western Indian Ocean. The conference will take place in Mauritius.
​The first round of Sri Lanka – Sweden political consultations concludes successfully on 09 November 2023

Sri Lanka and Sweden successfully concluded their first round of virtual bilateral political consultations at the senior official level on 09 November 2023. The consultations were held in anticipation of the 75th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the two countries.
Sri Lanka commends Qatar’s Facilitation for Evacuation of 11 Sri Lankans from Gaza

Sri Lanka's Minister of Foreign Affairs, M.U.M. Ali Sabry, commended Qatar for facilitating the evacuation of 11 Sri Lankans from Gaza. He appreciated the constructive role played by the State of Qatar under the guidance of His Highness Sheikh Tamim bin Hamad Al-Thani, Amir of the State of Qatar.
Ambassador of Norway presents Credentials to Sri Lanka

Ms. May-Elin Stener has been appointed as the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Kingdom of Norway to Sri Lanka with the concurrence of the Government of Sri Lanka. She presented her credentials to Sri Lanka as the official representative of Norway.
Ambassador of Venezuela presents Credentials to Sri Lanka

Ms. Capaya Rodriguez Gonzalez has been appointed as the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Bolivarian Republic of Venezuela to Sri Lanka. The Government of Venezuela, with the approval of Sri Lanka, has confirmed her credentials.
Ambassador of Finland presents Credentials to Sri Lanka

The Government of Finland has appointed Mr. Kimmo Lahdevirta as the new Ambassador to Sri Lanka with the approval of the Sri Lankan Government. Mr. Lahdevirta will serve as the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Finland in Sri Lanka.
Ambassador of Angola presents Credentials to Sri Lanka

Angola's Government appointed Mr. Clemente Pedro Camenha as Ambassador to Sri Lanka with the approval of the Sri Lankan Government. He presented his credentials as the new Ambassador of Angola to Sri Lanka.
Ambassador of Djibouti presents Credentials to Sri Lanka

Mr. Isse Abdillahi Assoweh has been appointed as the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of Djibouti to Sri Lanka. The Government of Djibouti, with the approval of Sri Lanka, has made this diplomatic appointment official.
Ambassador of Suriname presents Credentials to Sri Lanka

The Government of Suriname has appointed Mr. Arunkoemar Hardien as Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary to Sri Lanka with the approval of the Sri Lankan government. Mr. Hardien presented his credentials to Sri Lanka, officially beginning his diplomatic role.
Ambassador of Portugal presents Credentials to Sri Lanka

The Government of the Portuguese Republic, with the approval of the Government of Sri Lanka, has named Mr. Joao Manuel Mendes de Almeida as the new Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Portugal to Sri Lanka. Mr. Almeida has presented his credentials to the Sri Lankan authorities.
Ambassador of Cambodia presents Credentials to Sri Lanka

Mr. Koy Kuong has been appointed as the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Kingdom of Cambodia to Sri Lanka with the concurrence of both governments. He presented his credentials to Sri Lanka as the new ambassador.
Ambassador of Philippines presents Credentials to Sri Lanka

The Government of the Republic of the Philippines, with the approval of the Government of Sri Lanka, has designated Mr. Leo Tito Ausan, Jr. as the new Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary to Sri Lanka. Mr. Ausan presented his credentials in a formal ceremony to strengthen diplomatic ties between the two countries.
Ambassador of Latvia presents Credentials to Sri Lanka

Mr. Juris Bone has been appointed as the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Republic of Latvia to Sri Lanka. He presented his credentials to the Government of Sri Lanka, officially assuming his diplomatic role.
Eleven Sri Lankans safely arrived in Colombo from Gaza

Eleven Sri Lankan nationals, comprising two adults and nine children from two families, safely arrived in Colombo from the Gaza Strip this morning (05 November). The Consular Affairs Division facilitated their return home.
Eleven Sri Lankans safely arrived in Egypt from Gaza

Eleven Sri Lankan nationals safely arrived in Egypt from Gaza with the assistance of the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Cairo and the Egyptian authorities, along with support from the Sri Lankan Representative in Ramallah.
Discussion on advancement of women in the context of CEDAW

Foreign Secretary Aruni Wijewardane chaired a discussion on the advancement of women in the context of CEDAW with eminent Sri Lankan experts who have contributed internationally. The exchange of views focused on matters related to women's progress and empowerment.
Foreign Minister inaugurates Orientation Programme for Heads of Mission designate of Sri Lanka

Foreign Minister Ali Sabry inaugurated a two-week Orientation Programme for the Heads of Mission designate of Sri Lanka at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs on 01 November 2023. During the event, Minister Sabry outlined key aspects of the programme.
11th Inter-Parliamentary meeting between Sri Lanka and the EU concludes on 31 October 2023

The 11th Inter-Parliamentary meeting between Sri Lanka and the EU, specifically with the Delegation for relations with the countries of South Asia of the European Parliament (DSAS), concluded on 31 October 2023 at the Sri Lanka Parliament.
Inaugural Bilateral Consultations between Sri Lanka and France  25 October 2023, Colombo, Sri Lanka  Joint Communiqué

Sri Lanka and France held their first bilateral consultations at the senior official level in Colombo on 25 October 2023. The meeting marked the 75th anniversary of diplomatic relations between the two countries.
Ministry of Foreign Affairs Launches Hotline Facility for Sri Lankans to seek assistance in connection to the Conflict Situation in the Middle East

The Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Colombo has launched two emergency hotline mobile numbers for Sri Lankans seeking assistance related to the Conflict Situation in the Middle East. This initiative allows Sri Lankan nationals to contact the Ministry of Foreign Affairs promptly for support during this challenging time.
Consular Affairs Division of Ministry of Foreign Affairs launches Online authentication of GCE O/L & A/L Certificates

The Consular Affairs Division of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, in collaboration with the Department of Examinations, has introduced an online authentication service for GCE Ordinary Level (O/L) and Advanced Level (A/L) certificates. This new online service streamlines the process for verifying the authenticity of these certificates.
Appointment of Ambassador of the Islamic Republic of Iran to Sri Lanka
Dr. Alireza Delkhosh has been appointed as the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the Islamic Republic of Iran to Sri Lanka with the concurrence of the Government of Sri Lanka.
Appointment of Ambassador of the European Union to Sri Lanka

The European Union, in agreement with the Government of Sri Lanka, has named Ms. Carmen Moreno as the new Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the European Union to Sri Lanka. She will be stationed in Colombo to represent the EU in diplomatic matters.
Appointment of Ambassador of Switzerland to Sri Lanka

The Government of Switzerland, with the approval of the Government of Sri Lanka, has appointed Dr. (Ms.) Siri Walt as the new Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Switzerland to Sri Lanka. She will be based in Colombo.
Joint Statement between the People’s Republic of China and  the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka  Beijing, October 20, 2023

During the third Belt and Road Forum in Beijing on October 20, 2023, President Ranil Wickremesinghe of Sri Lanka attended at the invitation of President Xi Jinping of China. The two countries issued a joint statement outlining their cooperation and partnership.
President Wickremesinghe meets Chinese President Xi Jinping

President Xi Jinping of China affirmed China's commitment to supporting Sri Lanka's economic stability without political motives during a meeting with President Wickremesinghe. The Chinese President emphasized their dedication to assisting Sri Lanka's economic development.
A meeting between SL President and the Chinese Vice PM

During a meeting between the Sri Lankan President and the Chinese Vice Premier, Ding Xuexiang expressed gratitude for Sri Lanka's support under the historic Rubber-Rice Agreement with China. He highlighted the importance of the strong bilateral relationship between the two countries.
Launching a Special Initiative to Strengthen Climate Resilience in Tropical Nations

President Ranil Wickremesinghe highlighted the importance of addressing climate resilience in tropical nations during the "Green Silk Road for Harmony with Nature" high-level conference. He emphasized that tropical regions are home to the world's most biodiverse ecosystems, prompting the launch of a special initiative to strengthen their resilience.
Leaders of Vietnam and Sri Lanka hold bilateral discussions

Vietnamese President Vo Van Thuong affirmed Vietnam's commitment to strengthening cultural ties with Sri Lanka during bilateral discussions with Sri Lankan leaders. He expressed Vietnam's readiness to act as a bridge between the two nations, fostering closer cooperation and understanding.
Meeting between President of Sri Lanka and Prime Minister of Pakistan

The President of Sri Lanka held a bilateral meeting with Prime Minister of Pakistan, Anwaar-ul-Haq Kakar, on 17 October 2023 during the Third Belt and Road Forum for International Cooperation in Beijing. The meeting aimed to strengthen ties between the two countries.
President meets Indonesian President during visit to China

During his visit to China, President Ranil Wickremesinghe met with the Indonesian President to discuss enhancing Indian Ocean identity and bilateral cooperation. He emphasized the importance of strengthening political, economic, and cultural ties between Sri Lanka and Indonesia.
The President participates in an investment, trade and tourism forum in China

President Ranil Wickremesinghe participated in a significant investment, trade, and tourism forum during his official four-day visit to China. The forum aimed to enhance future business opportunities and strengthen economic ties between the two countries.
Malaysian Foreign Minister concludes a successful visit to Sri Lanka

Malaysian Foreign Minister Dato’ Seri Diraja Dr. Zambry Abd Kadir successfully concluded his official visit to Sri Lanka from 08 – 12 October 2023. During the visit, he engaged in official discussions and meetings with Sri Lankan officials.
​Sri Lanka assumes the Chair of the Indian Ocean Rim Association (IORA) at the 23rd Council of Ministers in Colombo

Sri Lanka took over the chairmanship of the Indian Ocean Rim Association (IORA) at the 23rd Council of Ministers in Colombo on October 11, 2023. The meeting was chaired by Foreign Minister Ali Sabry. Sri Lanka will lead the IORA in its upcoming initiatives and collaborations.
Welcome Statement- M.U.M Ali Sabry PC, Minister of Foreign Affairs, Sri Lanka  23rd Meeting of the IORA Council of Ministers, Colombo

At the 23rd Meeting of the IORA Council of Ministers in Colombo, M.U.M Ali Sabry PC, Minister of Foreign Affairs of Sri Lanka, greeted attendees with a warm welcome. He addressed Excellencies, Honourable Ministers, State Ministers, Heads of Delegations, the Secretary General of IORA, distinguished invitees, and all present, wishing them a pleasant morning.
Indian Ocean Rim Association’s 25th Committee of Senior Officials (CSO) Meeting concludes in Colombo

The 25th Committee of Senior Officials Meeting of the Indian Ocean Rim Association (IORA) concluded in Colombo, where officials from member states convened. The two-day meeting, chaired from 9-10 October 2023, aimed to discuss regional cooperation and initiatives within the IORA framework.
Sri Lanka Deeply Concerned about Attacks and Escalation of Violence in Israel and Palestine

Sri Lanka expresses deep concern over the attacks and escalating violence in Israel and Palestine, leading to loss of life. Sri Lanka urges an immediate halt to the violence and calls on all parties to exercise restraint.
Malaysian Foreign Minister Dato’ Seri Diraja Dr. Zambry Abd Kadir to visit Sri Lanka

Malaysian Foreign Minister Dato’ Seri Diraja Dr. Zambry Abd Kadir is set to visit Sri Lanka from 08 to 12 October 2023 on an official trip. The visit aims to strengthen diplomatic ties between Malaysia and Sri Lanka.
Sri Lanka to take over Chair of Indian Ocean Rim Association. Ministers meet in Colombo next week

Sri Lanka will assume the Chair of the Indian Ocean Rim Association, with ministers meeting in Colombo next week for the 23rd IORA Council of Ministers. Foreign Affairs ministers from IORA Member States and Dialogue Partners will attend the meeting.
Foreign Secretary Aruni Wijewardane meets State Secretary Thomas Bagger of the Federal Foreign Office of Germany

Foreign Secretary Aruni Wijewardane met with State Secretary Thomas Bagger of the Federal Foreign Office of Germany at the Federal Foreign Office in Berlin on 27 September 2023. The meeting aimed to discuss bilateral relations and cooperation between the two countries.
President Ranil Wickremesinghe holds talks with German Foundations Friedrich Naumann Foundation and Friedrich Ebert Foundation

During his working visit to Berlin from 27-30 September 2023, President Ranil Wickremesinghe held talks with the leadership of the Friedrich Naumann Foundation (FNF) and Friedrich Ebert Foundation (FEF). The discussions aimed to strengthen cooperation between Sri Lanka and the German foundations.
President holds Bilateral Talks with German Chancellor during Working Visit to Germany

President Ranil Wickremesinghe engaged in bilateral talks with German Chancellor Olaf Scholz in Berlin on Thursday (28) during his official visit to participate in the 'Berlin Global Dialogue'. The President was accompanied by his delegation during the meeting.
“A Comprehensive International Dialogue Essential to Address Global Challenges in 2024″

President Ranil Wickremesinghe emphasized the importance of a comprehensive international dialogue to address global challenges in 2024 during the opening speech at the Head of State Dialogue in the Berlin Global Conference.
President Ranil Wickremesinghe Embarks on High-Level Visit to Germany

President Ranil Wickremesinghe departed for Germany today to take part in the Leaders Dialogue session, the opening event of the 'Berlin Global Dialogue.' This visit signifies his engagement in high-level discussions and diplomatic exchanges.
High-level plenary meeting to commemorate and promote the   International Day for the Total Elimination of Nuclear Weapons  26 September 2023  United Nations Headquarters, New York

A high-level plenary meeting will be held at the United Nations Headquarters in New York on 26 September 2023 to commemorate and promote the International Day for the Total Elimination of Nuclear Weapons. The meeting aims to address the issue of nuclear disarmament, emphasizing the importance of eliminating nuclear weapons for global peace and security.
​Statement by Hon. Ali Sabry, Minister of Foreign Affairs of Sri Lanka  Ministerial Meeting of the Summit of the Future  21 September 2023

During the Ministerial Meeting of the Summit of the Future on September 21, 2023, Hon. Ali Sabry, Minister of Foreign Affairs of Sri Lanka, emphasized the significance of the event as a unique opportunity for Member States. He highlighted the forum's potential for collaboration and progress towards shared goals.

47th Annual Meeting of Ministers for Foreign Affairs of the Group of 77  “A path for the reform of the international financial architecture: towards a new and inclusive global economic order” Statement by Hon Ali Sabry, Minister of Foreign Affairs  22 September 2023

At the 47th Annual Meeting of Ministers for Foreign Affairs of the Group of 77, Hon Ali Sabry, Minister of Foreign Affairs of Sri Lanka, addressed the theme of reforming the international financial architecture for a more inclusive global economic order on 22 September 2023. Sabry, a founding member of the Group of 77, emphasized the importance of this annual forum in his statement to the Chairperson, Excellencies, and Distinguished Delegates.
Statement by the Foreign Minister at the Press Briefing on the Art. XIV Conference on Facilitating Entry into Force of the CTBT, New York, 21 September 2023

Foreign Minister addressed the Press Briefing ahead of the Article XIV Conference on the CTBT in New York on September 21, 2023. The Minister represented a country that ratified the treaty, emphasizing the importance of facilitating its entry into force.
Sri Lanka Ratifies Comprehensive Nuclear Test Ban Treaty (CTBT) and Expresses Commitment to Nuclear Non-Proliferation

Sri Lanka recently ratified the Comprehensive Nuclear Test Ban Treaty (CTBT) and expressed its dedication to nuclear non-proliferation during a press briefing at the EU Article 14 Conference. The country reaffirmed its unwavering commitment to nuclear disarmament, signaling its support for global efforts in this regard.
President Ranil Wickremesinghe’s Address at the UNGA: Sri Lanka’s Journey to Rebuild Trust and Global Solidarity

President Ranil Wickremesinghe addressed the UN General Assembly in New York on September 21, focusing on Sri Lanka's efforts to rebuild trust and global solidarity. He highlighted challenges, achievements, and the country's commitment to sustainable development and climate action. Wickremesinghe's speech emphasized the importance of fostering international cooperation for a better future.
President Wickremesinghe meets US President Joe Biden in New York
President Ranil Wickremesinghe met with US President Joe Biden in New York yesterday. The two leaders engaged in a cordial meeting during a lavish dinner hosted by President Biden.
Malaysian King extends state visit invitation to Sri Lanka’s President, scheduled for early 2024

Malaysia's King has invited Sri Lanka's President, Ranil Wickremesinghe, for a state visit scheduled for early 2024, marking a significant diplomatic gesture. The formal invitation aims to strengthen bilateral ties between the two countries.
​Foreign Minister Sabry participates in the​ 18th Ministerial Meeting of the Asia Cooperation Dialogue
Foreign Minister Ali Sabry attended the 18th Ministerial Meeting of the Asia Cooperation Dialogue (ACD) yesterday, held on the sidelines of the 78th session of the United Nations General Assembly.
Foreign Minister Sabry addresses High-Level Meeting on Pandemic Prevention, Preparedness and Response

Foreign Minister Ali Sabry addressed the High-Level Meeting on Pandemic Prevention, Preparedness, and Response during the 78th session of the United Nations General Assembly in New York on September 20.
IMF MD Kristalina Georgieva Commends Sri Lanka’s Economic Progress in Meeting with President Wickremesinghe at UNGA

IMF Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva praised Sri Lanka's economic progress in a meeting with President Wickremesinghe at the UNGA. Discussions centered on financial reforms and debt restructuring, highlighting the importance of ongoing economic initiatives.
Productive Talks with Secretary General Patricia Scotland Emphasize Commitment to Climate Financing and Diaspora Engagement

President Ranil Wickremesinghe leads climate change cooperation with the Commonwealth at UNGA, holding productive talks with Secretary General Patricia Scotland. The discussions highlight a shared commitment to climate financing and engaging the diaspora community, emphasizing the importance of collaboration in addressing global challenges.
President Wickremesinghe Addresses Global Financial Distress and Calls for Solidarity at 2023 SDG Summit

President Ranil Wickremesinghe addressed global financial distress and emphasized the need for solidarity at the 2023 SDG Summit. He highlighted the challenges faced by middle-income countries in his significant address at the High-level Dialogue on Financing for Development during the 78th session of the General Assembly.
President Ranil Wickremesinghe Pledges Sri Lanka’s Dual Approach to Climate Ambition at UN Climate Summit

President Ranil Wickremesinghe of Sri Lanka announced the country's dual approach to climate ambition at the UN Climate Summit. This includes unveiling the Climate Prosperity Plan and establishing the Climate Justice Forum to address global climate challenges. Wickremesinghe made the announcement during the Climate Ambition Summit held on the sidelines of the UN General Assembly.
President meets Iranian President on the side-lines of the UNGA

President Ranil Wickremesinghe met with Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi on the sidelines of the UNGA in New York on September 20. They discussed longstanding relations between their countries during the meeting.
President claims current state of SDG advancement is globally unsatisfactory

President Ranil Wickremesinghe, speaking at the SDG Summit 2023, expressed concern over the insufficient progress in advancing the Sustainable Development Goals globally. He questioned the feasibility of achieving the SDGs amidst the challenges posed by the pandemic fallout and resource scarcity.
Foreign Minister Sabry participates ​i​n the Global Development Initiative (GDI) high-level meeting

Foreign Minister Ali Sabry took part in the Global Development Initiative (GDI) Cooperation Outcomes high-level meeting in New York on September 19, 2023, during the 78th session of the United Nations.
Sri Lanka accedes to the Treaty on the Prohibition of Nuclear Weapons (TPNW)

Sri Lanka's Minister of Foreign Affairs, Ali Sabry, officially acceded to the Treaty on the Prohibition of Nuclear Weapons (TPNW) on 19 September 2023. The Instrument of Accession was deposited during a high-level ceremony at the UN Headquarters in New York.
President meets Prime Minister Pushpa Kamal Dahal of Nepal in New York

President Ranil Wickremesinghe met with Prime Minister Pushpa Kamal Dahal of Nepal in New York on the sidelines of the 78th United Nations General Assembly. The meeting took place yesterday (19) and provided an opportunity for discussions between the two leaders.
President and USAID Administrator Samantha Power Forge Strong Alliance at UNGA

President Ranil Wickremesinghe and USAID Administrator Samantha Power forged a strong alliance at the UNGA in New York. The President expressed his appreciation for the support extended by USAID during their discussions.
President Expresses Gratitude and Discusses Possible Visit to Bangladesh in Meeting with Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina

President Ranil Wickremesinghe expressed gratitude and discussed a possible visit to Bangladesh in a meeting with Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina in New York on September 19. The meeting focused on various diplomatic matters, strengthening ties between the two countries. President Wickremesinghe is considering a visit to Bangladesh in the near future.
President joins the Conference on Sustainable Development Goals
President Ranil Wickremesinghe participated in the Business Roundtable during the 78th session of the United Nations General Assembly, focusing on Sustainable Development Goals.
Sri Lanka and World Bank Discuss Economic Reforms and Collaborations

Sri Lanka's President Ranil Wickremesinghe led a delegation in discussions with World Bank President Ajay Banga and other officials at the World Bank Headquarters in New York. The talks focused on economic reforms and potential collaborations between Sri Lanka and the World Bank.
South Korea pledges its support for Sri Lanka’s economic recovery

South Korea has pledged support for Sri Lanka's economic recovery by focusing on expanding investment and trade ties. The agreement aims to increase employment opportunities for Sri Lankan youth in South Korea in the near future, strengthening bilateral relations between the two countries.

Address by HE Ranil Wickremesinghe – President of Sri Lanka at the Summit of the Heads of State and Government of the G77 & China on Current Development Challenges: The Role of Science, Technology and Innovation -on 15 September 2023 in Havana, Cuba

President Ranil Wickremesinghe of Sri Lanka addressed the Summit of the Heads of State and Government of the G77 & China in Havana, Cuba on September 15, 2023. He praised Cuba for championing the concerns of developing nations in multilateral forums and emphasized the role of science, technology, and innovation in addressing current development challenges.
President Ranil Wickremesinghe Addresses G77 & China Summit in Cuba

President Ranil Wickremesinghe addressed the G77 & China Summit in Cuba, emphasizing the importance of science, technology, and innovation in tackling global development challenges. His compelling speech highlighted the role of these factors in addressing pressing issues faced by nations worldwide.
Cuban and Sri Lankan Presidents Forge Stronger Ties and Mutual Support through Bilateral Talks

During an official visit to Cuba, Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe strengthened ties and mutual support through bilateral talks with Cuban President. The visit preceded his participation in the G77 plus China Summit in Havana, hosted by Cuba as the current Chair of the G77 plus China. This visit aimed to enhance cooperation between the two nations.
Sri Lanka to assume the Chairmanship of the Indian Ocean Rim Association (IORA), 2023 – 2025

Sri Lanka is set to assume the Chairmanship of the Indian Ocean Rim Association (IORA) from 2023 to 2025. The official handover will take place at the 23rd Council of Ministers’ Meeting in Colombo on October 11, 2023.
Foreign Minister and Minister of Justice brief the Diplomatic Corps on the draft Anti-Terrorism Bill

The Foreign Minister and Minister of Justice briefed the Diplomatic Corps at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Colombo on the draft Anti-Terrorism Bill on September 1, 2023. The briefing provided updates on current developments related to the bill.
Ministry of Foreign Affairs introduces digital platform to follow up Treaties and MoUs

The Ministry of Foreign Affairs has launched a digital platform to manage and monitor bilateral and multilateral Treaties, Agreements, and Memoranda of Understanding. This platform aims to streamline the coordination of ongoing and upcoming international agreements effectively.
Foreign Secretaries of Sri Lanka and Thailand successfully conclude Bilateral Political Consultations

The 5th Round of Sri Lanka-Thailand Bilateral Political Consultations successfully concluded on August 28, 2023, at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Colombo. The Sri Lankan delegation, led by the Secretary of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, engaged in productive discussions with their Thai counterparts, strengthening diplomatic ties between the two countries.
Sri Lanka and Thailand to hold 5th Round of Bilateral Political Consultations in Colombo

Sri Lanka and Thailand are set to conduct their 5th Round of Bilateral Political Consultations on August 28, 2023, at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Colombo. The consultations will be co-chaired by the Foreign Secretary of both countries.
Appointment of Ambassador of the Federal Republic of Germany to Sri Lanka

The Government of the Federal Republic of Germany, with the agreement of the Government of Sri Lanka, has appointed Dr. Felix Neumann as the new Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary to Sri Lanka. Dr. Neumann will represent Germany in his diplomatic role in Sri Lanka.
Appointment of High Commissioner of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland to Sri Lanka
The Government of the United Kingdom, in agreement with Sri Lanka, has appointed Mr. Andrew Patrick as the new High Commissioner of the UK to Sri Lanka.
Appointment of Ambassador of the Republic of Italy to Sri Lanka
The Government of Italy, in agreement with Sri Lanka, has appointed Mr. Damiano Francovigh as the new Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Italy to Sri Lanka.
President Embarks on a Two-Day Official Visit to Singapore

President Ranil Wickremesinghe is scheduled to depart for a two-day official visit to Singapore tomorrow morning. During the visit, he will meet with Singaporean officials to discuss bilateral relations and cooperation.
Foreign Minister Sabry briefs Diplomatic Corps on Current Developments in Sri Lanka
Foreign Minister Ali Sabry briefed the Colombo-based diplomatic corps on current developments in Sri Lanka on August 16, 2023. The briefing also included Foreign Secretary Aruni Wijewardane.
Sri Lankan Workers involved in Accident in Istanbul Treated and Recovering

Sri Lankan workers involved in an accident in Istanbul on August 9, 2023, while being transported from their worksite to accommodation are now being treated and are in recovery. The workers were in Istanbul, Turkey, and the accident occurred as they were traveling within the same vicinity.
Foreign Minister Ali Sabry concludes successful visit to Iran
Sri Lankan Foreign Minister Ali Sabry successfully concluded his official visit to Iran from August 4 to 7, 2023, upon an invitation from the Iranian Foreign Minister.
Foreign Minister Ali Sabry to visit Iran
Foreign Minister Ali Sabry will visit Iran from August 4 to 7, 2023, following an invitation from Iranian Foreign Affairs Minister Dr. Hossei.
Japanese Foreign Minister HAYASHI leads a high-level delegation to Sri Lanka

Japanese Foreign Minister HAYASHI Yoshimasa led a high-level delegation to Sri Lanka on an official visit from July 28-29, 2023. During the visit, Minister of Foreign Affairs Ali Sabry engaged in a comprehensive bilateral discussion with Minister HAYASHI, strengthening ties between the two countries.
French President Pledges Strong Support for Debt Restructuring and Bolsters Bilateral Relations during Historic Visit to Sri Lanka

French President Emmanuel Macron made a historic visit to Sri Lanka on the 28th, the first by a French President to the country. During the visit, Macron pledged strong support for debt restructuring and strengthened bilateral relations.
Sri Lanka donates a consignment of Ceylon Tea to the civilians affected by the Cyclone MOCHA in Myanmar

Sri Lanka donated 1 metric ton of Ceylon Tea to civilians affected by Cyclone MOCHA in Myanmar. The donation was handed over by the Sri Lankan government at an event organized by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.
French President Emmanuel Macron to undertake a visit to Sri Lanka

French President Emmanuel Macron will visit Sri Lanka on 28 July 2023, marking the first-ever visit by a French President to the country. This historic visit follows his trip to the South Pacific region.
Japanese Foreign Minister HAYASHI to visit Sri Lanka
Japanese Foreign Minister Yoshimasa Hayashi will visit Sri Lanka on July 28-29, 2023, for official discussions.
Sri Lanka ratifies Comprehensive Nuclear Test-Ban Treaty (CTBT)

Sri Lanka ratified the Comprehensive Nuclear Test-Ban Treaty (CTBT) by depositing the instrument of ratification with the UN Office of Legal Affairs on 25 July 2023 at the UN Headquarters in New York. With this action, Sri Lanka became the 178th State to ratify the CTBT, demonstrating its commitment to nuclear non-proliferation.
